definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: The effort to privatize state-owned enterprises turned into an enrichment scheme for cronies of the regime.
sentences.chinese: 而國企私有化則成了政權姻親的致富模式。

sentences.english: Hassles with in-laws could put a damper on your day.
sentences.chinese: 與姻親的矛盾可能會讓你掃興。

sentences.english: The Guest Apartment features a kitchenette for your in- law’s or guest’s convenience.
sentences.chinese: 客房公寓備有一個小廚房，方便您的姻親或客人使用。

sentences.english: What is the difference between in-laws and outlaws ?
sentences.chinese: 姻親與不法之徒有什麼差別？

sentences.english: Chapter V gens and affinity and the social relief.
sentences.chinese: 第五章宗族姻親與社會救助。

sentences.english: A man doesn't feel right, battening on his in-laws .
sentences.chinese: 一個男人要靠姻親過活是不好受的。

sentences.english: Feifei: Oh I see! A weekend with the in-laws.
sentences.chinese: 哦，原來是要和姻親一起過週末。

definition: each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
